entry.title: VFA February 2013 Update
entry.summary:
I dont know you have all been waiting with baited breath since my last announcement and we have big news for you this time. We had our opening kickoff meeting and will continue to have meetings twice a month until we get closer to our convention. We don't want to leave you all in the dark so without further ado I will get right to the point;

2013-02 Meeting Announcements

  • We are looking at a 200 person venue for our date in Fall.
  • We will not be announcing any details until we have contracts signed.
  • We will start doing open staff interviews March 21st.
  • We have decided to start holding grill outs at the Monthly Board meet to take signups and also act as a public suggestion/forum.
  • We will start posting new content every week to this site.
    • We will be posting meeting recaps for everyone.
    • Also we will recap upcoming meets and announcements every week.

The Monthly Grill Outs

VFA is so much more than just a convention; we want to support the community as a whole. One of the ways we came up with to do this and help get people excited for the con is adding a VFA sponsored grill out to the monthly park meet we already have.

We will be brining out own grill, dogs & burgers, and a heat lamp since it's still a bit brisk. While everyone is nomming the delicious we will also be passing around signup and suggestion sheets. I will probably try to sneak in some boca burgers so my vegetarian brethren can still join in.

Weekly Announcements

We want to try and be a central and neutral repository for information for out locals and visitors. Hopefully on a weekly basis we will be posting all the open events to our site, which you can follow in your RSS reader if you choose.

If you have any announcements or events you want posted here please email staff at vegas fur dot com. We will try to watch the board and Facebook to catch things but we are only human so your help is ALWAYS appreciated. If interest is high I will put up a signup form as well.

entry.title: Don't Call it a Comeback
entry.summary:
We were never gone!

I know you have all been waiting too long for the results of the contest and we're really sorry that hasn't been announced. Sadly this isn't the announcement of the winner but it is still coming soon. This is just a quick update since we have left you all hanging.

Internally we had suffered some setbacks as some people have dropped from the project before it really got off the ground. However we have been working to fill those gaps and put ourselves not just right back on track but far ahead! We have some new tentative commitments to the convention and lots of offers for help recently. If you still want to help put on local events or volunteer for the convention please email staff at vegasfur dot com with any information and we will make sure to get back to you quickly!

We are going to try and commit to posting on a regular basis with at least some news just so we don't leave everyone hanging for so long.

entry.title: FVA is Hiring!
entry.summary:
Vegas Furry Arts needs dedicated fuzzies excited about helping run amazing events to benefit the Souther Nevada furry and arts! Currently we are just a two man team and we've decided we don't want to black box our board or even go about the normal way of picking all of our friends for board and staff. Instead we will be going though a hiring procedure!

We are officially open for all applications! Please send your full resume and cover letter explaining what position you are looking to fill, something that you feel the community can really benefit from, and what you feel you bring to Vegas Furry Arts to staff (at) vegasfur (dot) com.

Open Positions

Here are some things to keep in mind when submitting;

  • Please remember we are not just about conventions. This group's goal is to host regular open furry events all around town such as; art shows, formals, parties, craft events, first friday, and other possible cross-community participation events.
  • Currently we are only actively hiring for the director position. Please feel free to submit for staffing positions but until we find a director and form our not for profit we will not be calling back or interviewing for anything else.
  • We are not for profit, not non-profit so there will be no payout or salary. As staff of VFA you will be expected to contribute to the running and maintenance of the group and as a director you will be expected to contribute a large share of the several thousands of dollars it takes to start and run a not for profit.
  • We are not accepting outside investors/donators currently.
  • Serious inquiries only.

Director position

Vegas Furry Arts is currently looking for a third director to help form and manage VFA. As a steering board member you will need to be able to communicate well and in a timely manner, helping drive community events, and guide the staff & events of VFA in line with it's goals of cultivating art and community in the Las Vegas Furry community. We will be working with several other furry and similar groups in town to help unify and cultivate our art.

The board will comprise of three members, which are registered members of the not for profit incorporation and will all carry equal responsibility of the future of the group fiscally until the time when a treasurer is appointed.

Qualifications

  • Staff Leadership and Management experience.
  • 1+ years in a leadership role in community events.
  • Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal skills.
  • Great additude and outlook.
  • Strong people, organization, and financial management skills.
  • Ability to work in a team and handle multiple tasks in an organized and timely manner.
  • Experience with GTD based productivity a plus.
  • Working knowledge/training on board governance will be a plus.

entry.title: A convention by any other name
entry.summary:
Things are really kicking into high gear over here! We are setting up to get VFA registered, have a few venues on the list of possibilities, hiring is about to open, ideas are getting hashed out, deals getting formed...

But don't have a name for our convention! This is where we reach out to the people this con is for, please help us name our new furcon!

All you need to do is use the comments to post your best name ideas. Please don't fill them up with "+1, this one, seconded, ect" replies, just post your original ideas. On Nevada Day (The Last Friday of October) we will close out the comments and pick the top three suggestions. Those three will be turned into a poll where everyone can vote on the final name for our new con!

Now here is where we sweeten the deal. The fur who originally posts the final name for the convention1 will receive our equivalent of a black badge, meaning free admission for life. How sweet is that!? Yea, as long as this convention bares the name you choose you get in for free2.

However, the first person to suggest the name PafCon will pay the winners registration for life3. ^_^

  1. Of course this blog allows for mostly anonymous comments. If you choose to be anonymous or use a name that we cannot directly and definitely link you to then your eligibility for any prize or reward is forfeited. ↩

  2. Obviously there are rules. You will be required to sign over the name and any associated copyrights over to us for liability reasons. The free registration for life only applies to you and is only valid for as long as the convention retains the name. The offer cannot be transferred, traded, or sold. You may not use this offer in conjunction with any other offers, nor may you use this to register for or on behalf of anyone else. This reward has no cash value and is not a legal agreement promising admittance or a held badge in your name. You will still be required to register as a regular attendee but at time of payment cost will be reduced to $0.00 USD. In order to claim this prize you must provide a valid state ID and your name and information will be logged with VFA. ↩

  3. LEGAL NOTICE: The first person to suggest the name PafCon will NOT have to pay the winners registration for life, that's a joke. ↩

entry.title: Joining Forces
entry.summary:
In one of my better or worse moments I have been talking to CynWolf of MidFur fame. He too has visited the land of sun and never-ending entertainment and realized that Las Vegas doesn't need a furry convention it deserves one... Obviously there was a great war fought on the lines of IRC and iMessage to decide how we shalt handle the great joining of powers and style of festivities. However, once our hearts were searched and the great truth was reflected on fact remains we both wanted the same thing at heart and have decided to join teams! It will be a shaky alliance and many wars will be fought across time(zones) and space but in the end this dark alliance will allow Vegas to benefit from all the awesome power of MidFur!!!

On a more serious note we had a long talk about it. We both have separate ideals on what the con should be like, especially in the first years. In the end we will hash it out to a solid middle ground which will hopefully be the best con possible for all of the Vegas Furs.

As for VFA? I think this just means all of it's plans are accelerated. I have started talking to my top candidates for board members and people are really coming together for this one. By the end of August we should have VFA legally solidified and start working on locations, staffing, and budget. By the end of the year we should be beyond ready for our target of Nevada Day 2013 for our first convention.

entry.title: Pre-Con Ideas (The August 2012 Edition)
entry.summary:
So I wanted to write up the pre-plan of the convention that VFA is planning. If anything just to have all the notes in one place for reference. We still have a bit to go to get there but more importantly we have plenty of time to do it in!

Date

  • October 2013
    • Use Nevada day holiday?
    • Start with a one day event?

Attendance & Registration

  • Cap attendance at size of one ballroom
  • All cash registration to save overhead
  • Do pre-reg at the local meets!
  • Keep registration as cheap as possible
    • Base it on ballroom rate + expense / 200 heads
  • All overages go to VFA treasury for next event
    • Zero payroll
    • Zero payouts
  • Simple laminate badges; universal & transferable
    • DefCon like registration makes it really easy
    • No worries on tracking or printing on site
    • Badges could be shared but not free replaced if lost
  • Post a waiver everyone must sign
    • Standard disclaimer and disavow of liability
    • Have a separate one for under 18 to require parent consent

Layout

  • Hold everything one one ballroom
    • This makes everything cheaper & easier to manage
    • Also prevents ghosting (no badge, no entrance)
  • Divide room with space not physical dividers.
  • Use backstage area as fursuit lounge.
  • Area for artists to hang art
  • No open adult content at all, no age separation
    • Vendors may be able to work around this with strict check-ID
  • Fursuiters will need to change in the fursuit area
    • concession to hotel, security
    • No masks or suits allowed outside con area
    • We MIGHT be able to get a small connected room for changing

Events

  • Have a few small panels focused on art
    • painting
    • anatomy
    • fursuiting Q&A
    • Fursuit building
  • Have some entertainment on the stage?
    • Vegas has some musicians
    • Live draw
  • A few discussion panels
    • Fun in vegas for all ages
    • Living furry
  • Static stuff
    • Lego table
    • Video game area
    • Tabletop game area (Ocean?)
    • Maybe fursuit/ears&tails construction area

Sweet side ideas

  • Have a build panel where someone brings in a whole lotta material and stuff and then for a fee they can join the panel and build their own ears.
  • Local artist Guest of Honor! Way cooler than popufur contest. Lets highlight the local talent!
  • Try to arrange a small cheap room block. Even though it's local targeted we still want post con room parties and to have plenty of out of town friends come in. Cheap rooms sweeten the deal.
